page.title: 16St.Helen's,Cliffe
page.content: Cliffe's parish church of St.Helen's has a history dating to about 1260 when the tower,nave and transept are thought to have been built.But the ecclesiastical connections of the village go well beyond this.An original name of Cliffe-at-Hoo was Cloveshoh where a church council of the Anglo-Saxons existed between A.D. 716 and 825.The Kings of Kent and Mercia would have attended together with principal bishops. The present church is faced with Kentish rag and flint in alternate courses.In 1862 the bells were recast and in 1864 two more were added making in all eight musical bells.
